intro: Astracantha rayatensis, commonly known as the Rayatensis milkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, attracting pollinators such as butterflies and bees. Its leaves are opposite and often have a velvety texture, while its stems are cylindrical and covered in fine hairs. Astracantha rayatensis is adapted to grow in dry, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
